head.title: Landowners File Suit To Block Condemnation

hedline.hl1: Landowners File Suit To Block Condemnation

abstract.p: Federal District Court Judge Harold Baer Jr issues temporary restraining order barring officials in Port Chester, NY, from condemning private buildings that are part of downtown redevelopment plan before hearing (S)

block.p: Three Port Chester property owners who stand to lose their buildings under a downtown redevelopment plan have filed a federal lawsuit to overturn the state law that lets governments take over private property.
Judge Harold A. Baer Jr. of Federal District Court in Manhattan issued a temporary restraining order barring town officials from condemning the properties before a hearing on Thursday.

Three Port Chester property owners who stand to lose their buildings under a downtown redevelopment plan have filed a federal lawsuit to overturn the state law that lets governments take over private property.
Judge Harold A. Baer Jr. of Federal District Court in Manhattan issued a temporary restraining order barring town officials from condemning the properties before a hearing on Thursday.

A nonprofit group, the Institute for Justice, has joined with the landowners in the suit. They say the state law is unfair because landowners are notified about possible condemnation only through legal notices in the newspaper, and not by notices sent to them directly.
